pageContext.claim: “November 3rd is a big day. Get out. Get the parents, get the friends, get the husband, get the wife, get everybody. Now, the difference is they get everybody, even if they're not registered -- if they're not citizens, if they're here illegally. They get everybody. That's one of the little difficulties.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump regularly promotes a number of different voter-fraud conspiracy theories, including this variation, in which Democrats are allegedly registering foreign nationals to vote. Foreigners are not allowed to vote and cannot register. The voter registration system across all states and territories has multiple layers of security, and documented instances of voter fraud are exceedingly rare, the odds being lower than those of being struck by lightning.
